metadata.title: CVE-2024-36617 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
FFmpeg n6.1.1 has an integer overflow vulnerability in the FFmpeg CAFdecoder.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36617` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7
libavformat57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7
libavresample3 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7
libavutil55 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7
libpostproc54 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7
libswresample2 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7
libswscale4 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm7').
